result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler A Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: On Count #1, the Court sentences the Defendant to 4 1/2   years Imprisonment, consisting of 3 years Initial Confinement and 1 year 6 months Extended Supervision.  This sentence is to be served consecutive to any other sentence. The Court STAYS this sentence and places Mr. Johnson on Probation for 3 years

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
[ma] Case called at 3:55 PM 
Defendant Tyler A Johnson in court with Attorney Michael Yang.   DA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Maximum penalties are recited; Constitutional rights are reviewed; plea of " NO CONTEST " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance is verified.  The Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2.

Sentencing recommendations/ arguments given by Counsel 
Statement made by Mr. Johnson

On Count #1, the Court sentences the Defendant to 4 1/2   years Imprisonment, consisting of 3 years Initial Confinement and 1 year 6 months Extended Supervision.  This sentence is to be served consecutive to any other sentence. 

The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives  22   days credit for time already served.

The Court STAYS this sentence and places Mr. Johnson on Probation for 3 years, with conditions: 
--to serve 6 months in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence on  6/24/22 at 6:00pm
---Mr.Johnson is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling per Agent
--random drug and/or alcohol screening
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agent
--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--take any and all prescription medications only as prescribed by treating physician
--to comply with DNA sample provision 
--payment of costs, fees and surcharges

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant

recess: 4:43pm

Pre-trial conference on May 11, 2022 at 11:40 am.
Status conference on June 10, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

[ma] Case called at 8:42 AM [Court Reporter: Rose Roderick]
Defendant Tyler A Johnson in court with Attorney Michael Yang.  Krysta Parson appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Mr. Johnson waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--Defendant stands mute; pleas of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess: 8:48am 

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 5/11/22 at 11:40am   (2) Status Conference on 6/10/22 at 2:30pm

[ma]Case called at 1:51am 
Defendant Tyler A Johnson appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Jeffrey De La Rosa(SPD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Court sets over to allow spd additional time to appoint counsel.
recess 1:53  pm. 

NEXT: Status of Counsel on 4/18/22 at 8:30am
Adjourned initial appearance on February 9, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case
Conditions of this Bond include:  to maintain absolute sobriety

[MK] case called at 1:25pm
Defendant Tyler A Johnson appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Amber Rumpf (the PD eligibility determination is pending until more financial information is available).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 
The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Right to counsel is given. 
The Court adjourns the Initial Appearance, tolling the preliminary hearing time limits. The Court preserves Mr. Johnson's Constitutional and jurisdictional rights. 

The Court requires a $1,000 Cash Bond with conditions:
--to maintain absolute sobriety 
recess 1:34pm. 

NEXT: (1) clerk- add the Jail to the mailing matrix (Mr. Johnson is on a DOC Hold in the Jail currently),  (2) Adjourned Initial Appearance (and status of counsel hearing) on February 9th at 1:15pm
